---
title: "Reproducible Workflows: Git/GitHub Workflows Task 2"
html:
    code-tools: true
    highlight-style: github
---

1. Fork this repository by clicking on the fork button in the top right corner of the GitHub page.
2. After forking, you will have your own copy of the repository in your GitHub account
3. Open your command line interface (CLI) or terminal.
4. Clone it to your computer using `git clone <your-forked-SSH-repo-url>` - don't use the HTTPS link.
5. *(git branch - optional)* Create a new branch for your changes: `git checkout -b <your-branch-name>`
6. Find the file with your assigned number in `data/birth-dates/`
7. Open the file and add the correct birth date for the pioneer listed.
8. Save the file.
9. Stage, commit, and push your changes to your forked repository using the process from Task 1.
10. Open a pull request from your forked repository to the original repository. by doing the following:
    * Go to your forked repository on GitHub.
    * Click the "Contribute" button and "Open a pull request".
    * Add a title and description for your pull request.
    * Click "Create pull request".
11. Wait for your pull request to be reviewed and merged.
